title: Pre-beta demo
content:
Check out a playable pre-beta (hence the alpha) demo of my game! It includes one full level, without an exit point since there's nowhere to go once you exit.
[url=http://keen.keenx.com/keen/files/keen_alpha.zip]keen.keenx.com/keen/files/keen_alpha.zip[/url]

There's a lot to do still. For example, the swimming movement is crap, and the dopefish is way too slow. And possibly too dumb too, but he IS a dopefish!
Ledge climbing control has some work to do. Just remember, when you grab a ledge, you'll need to release the direction you want to climb, and then press it again if you want to climb up. Or press down to let go.
Slikey is there. Don't be too mean, he has limited vision, can see only directly in front of him for a short distance. At least he can see through walls. He gets a little excited and surprised when he sees you.
The graphics reflect the completion of the game. (Not complete.)
Also, there are over 71,000 points in the level.

Big thanks to Commander Spleen who has helped a lot with finding bugs! I even fixed a couple of them. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Enjoy!

title: Re: Pre-beta demo
content:
Ooh, not bad at all!

- I like the new Keen graphics.
- The enemy AIs are pretty good.
- The pogo jump is kind of fake, try using one variable from which a value is continually being added/subtracted while pogoing, and set the Keen Y position to his y position + this variable for a smooth pogo effect.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: hehe
content:
Hey, this has got some potential. The nitpicks that I noticed were:

1) I can grab a ledge while moving UP in a jump... I'd like to be able to avoid grabbing a ledge until I'm falling back DOWN.

2) If I'm swimming in the water, and I just hold up and left or up and right, Keen spazzes out and twitches along the top of the water... can you fix that?

3) Enemies I've already stunned get in the way of shooting other enemies! I juggle corpses, rather than shooting multiple enemies! Is this intentional?

Other than that, the new sprite looks good so far. Work on keeping Keen's proportions more stable, and keep your perspectives matching... but otherwise very nice as a pre-beta.

title: Re: hehe
content:
Hey, pretty nice. I'm sure the "corpse juggling" is intentional. Cool feature IMKO.

Perhaps the sinking speed could be reduced? Keen sinks a bit too fast I think.

The new enemy is pretty good. Nice work.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: hehe
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]The pogo jump is kind of fake[hr][/quote] This has been mentioned by others too. I think I might finally have an idea what's wrong with it.

[quote]Quote:[hr] I can grab a ledge while moving UP in a jump... I'd like to be able to avoid grabbing a ledge until I'm falling back DOWN.[hr][/quote] Good point, it shall be so...
[quote]Quote:[hr]If I'm swimming in the water...[hr][/quote]Commander Spleen had a great idea for this: Have the player tread water for a second at the surface.
[quote]Quote:[hr]Enemies I've already stunned get in the way...Is this intentional?[hr][/quote]Yes. But it doesn't have to be. When they are stunned, they remain solid. Why? Well, don't these points look suspiciously impossible to reach?
[img]http://keen.keenx.com/temp/spikeyslikey.jpg[/img]
And there's this interesting line in the code for when Slikey get's stunned:
this->CanHoldObjectsOnTop = true;
[quote]Quote:[hr]Perhaps the sinking speed could be reduced?[hr][/quote] Indeed! I don't like the water movment in general, but figured that was a "minor" issue for releasing a pre-beta..
[quote]Quote:[hr]Btw, how long ago was the last Keen fangame (demo) before this one?[hr][/quote] Unfortunately I don't have nearly as much time as I'd like to spend on this. The last tech demo was put out on October 11 of last year: http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm17.showMessageRange?topicID=1111.topic&start=33&stop=40

title: Re: hehe
content:
Progress continues, though not quite as fast as I would like. Since that last demo, most of my time has been spent adding required systems and features. So nothing is really polished or demo-worthy, but here's a quick list of what's been added since the demo:
1. Map mode (and switching from a map to a level and back)
2. Game menu (escape goes to the menu rather than closing the game)
3. Sounds (shamelessly ripped a couple from keen 4 for testing)
4. Music
5. Settings (custom controls, volume, etc.)
6. Level loading progress bar

I like to update the progress on the project occasionally for anyone who's interested. But since I don't want to clutter the PCKF with little updates, I've been posting small updates to my message board at [url=http://forums.keenx.com]forums.keenx.com[/url]
Feel free to visit. And of course it's open to any keeners, so join and discuss if you'd like.

title: Re: Lineart
content:
Speaking of lineart... here's what I'm currently working on...
[img]http://keen.keenx.com/temp/bongortrun_bw.gif[/img]

title: Re: Lineart
content:
That's some great animation. Was that hand-drawn or did you use some kind of utility? From the consistent sizing of the components, I'd guess the latter.

As for the dopefish... two frames worked well at 320x240, but at this resolution you're going to need more than that. It would also work much better if you drew it from scratch. If you can make it animate like that blue critter, you'll be doing well.

Might I suggest rethinking the way you render your images? IMKO, the default-Photoshop style shading makes the image feel even flatter than the unshaded version.

Looking at Z's avatar, I notice he uses a similar technique but somehow manages to make it work. Whatever he's doing to get that effect, do that.

title: Re: Lineart
content:
Thanks... First I hand-drew the character in a couple of poses to establish what I wanted it to look like. Then I "deconstructed" the character: hand-sketched each segment by itself. (The body/head, arm and two leg pieces.) Scanned these, then made a "base" image with each piece on it's own layer. Then all I had to do was rotate and move the layers the way I wanted. (Gimp: Layer->Transform->Arbitrary Rotation...)
All of this was done with a very oversize image. Because when you rotate things, they get fuzzy, but once you shrink them down a lot of the fuzziness goes away.

title: Re: Lineart
content:
This is exceptional.


It needs to be tuned up quite a bit... But this is an impressive demo.

(BTW, check out my message for you, Zach, in Official Games. I think I already have your MSN handler. Could you give it to me again?)~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
